title: Eton College
summary: Eton College (/ˈiːtən/)[3] is a public school (English independent boarding school for boys) in the town of Eton, near Windsor in Berkshire, (historically in Buckinghamshire) England. It was founded in 1440 by Henry VI as "Kynge's College of Our Ladye of Eton besyde Windesore"[4][5] as a sister institution to King's College, Cambridge, making it the 18th-oldest Headmasters' and Headmistresses' Conference (HMC) school. Eton is particularly well-known for its history, wealth, and notable alumni.[6]
